p: Similar to calcite and chlorophyll- a, pH has a strong coastal component related to salinity, especially around the Amazonian river mouth, where pH drops below 7, and in the Virginian and Carolinian regions, where values exceed 8.25â€”both regions are devoid of the anthozoan. Regarding pH alone, a habitat with a pH over 7.85 is considered suitable, but due to correlations with the other variables, the habitat of P. caribaeorum is constrained to a pH between 8.05 and 8.25.
